FuncDef:
The backup-rpf-switchover-delay flow-based command delays forwarding entry generation on new interfaces connected to backup upstream devices in PIM FRR scenarios.
The undo backup-rpf-switchover-delay flow-based command restores the default configuration.
By default, forwarding entry generation is not delayed on new interfaces connected to backup upstream devices in PIM FRR scenarios.
ParentView: PIM view of a public network instance

ParaDef.Info:

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In IGP ECMP-based or non-ECMP-based PIM FRR scenarios, IGP route changes will trigger frequent PIM backup inbound interface switchovers, causing frequent master/backup forwarding entry switchovers on the forwarding plane. As a result, the rapid convergence function of PIM FRR is adversely affected. To resolve this issue, run the backup-rpf-switchover-delay flow-based command to delay forwarding entry generation on new interfaces connected to backup upstream devices.
Configuration Impact
If the backup-rpf-switchover-delay flow-based command is run for more than one, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
